Text saved: A gene is a small part of your body. It tells your body how to grow and work. We have more questions about how genes affect our brain and language. Did a gene change and give us the power to speak? Scientists found a change in a gene. This happened between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This change seems connected to speaking. It is also connected to how our brains move our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change. It is too early to say how important genes are for language. But one day we might find the answers in our DNA. DNA is the material in our bodies that has all our genes.
